CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 11, 1949, pg. 9 reads: "Women Of The Week... - Luncheon given last Wednesday at Dutch Henry's swank restaurant downtown, honored thirty-nine Pittsburghers (with many who could not attended deserving of honors)...with the funds benefiting Camp Achievement. Mrs. Toki Schalk Johnson, who sponsored the appearance of the women, gave their history while Mrs. Joseph Shuman presented awards of merit, and Mrs. Carrie Young pinned American Beauty roses on each shoulder.  The flowers were the gift of Alec lee of Lee's Floral Shop.  Pictured are the honorees, snapped by Teenie Harris following the affair. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of eighteen women wearing hats, including Charlotte Catlin Enty third from left in front row, and two holding certificates of merit, one possibly inscribed to "C. L. Mellon," posed in Dutch Henry's Restaurant
